title: How to Prove Your Love to Your Girlfriend over Text

steps.title: Sometimes it's best to keep it simple.
steps.content: Sometimes it's best to keep it simple. Sure, there are lots of ways you can show your girlfriend how much she means to you, and it's fun to mix it up sometimes! But those three little words are very powerful. Chances are, she wants to hear you say, "I love you." If you speak another language, it can be really romantic to say, "I love you," in a different language—like "Je t'aime" in French, "Te quiero" in Spanish, or "Saranghee yo" in Korean. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Share something unique that you like about her.
steps.content: Share something unique that you like about her. The best compliments are heartfelt and personal, so think about what makes your girlfriend really special. She's pretty, of course, but try to think beyond that—what are some qualities that really make her stand out? [2] X Expert Source Suzanna Mathews Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 18 August 2021. Try saying something like: "I love how you're always up for an adventure." [3] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 22 September 2021. "You have the best style!" "You're always listening to the coolest music." "It's impossible to be in a bad mood around you!"

steps.title: Being curious shows her you want to connect on a deeper level.
steps.content: Being curious shows her you want to connect on a deeper level. Asking questions gives her the chance to share more of herself with you, so it's a great way to get even closer to her. If you want to make it extra playful, turn it into a game like 21 questions, where you take turns asking each other random things. [4] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 22 September 2021. Try asking things like: Do you have anything big coming up this week? What's your biggest fear? What's been your best day of the year so far? Do you have any really amazing childhood memories? If you could turn into any animal, what would it be? Reader Poll: We asked 480 wikiHow readers which texting game they’d most enjoy playing with their boyfriend, and 53% of them said 20 Questions. [Take Poll] So whether you ask 20 or 21 questions, she's sure to enjoy answering them.

steps.title: Paying attention will show her you care.
steps.content: Paying attention will show her you care. It can be tempting to skim through your girlfriend's texts, especially if you're really busy. When you have time, slow down and really read through everything she's saying so you don't miss anything. Then, take note of small things she mentions so you can bring them back up later. [5] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 10 June 2021. If she says she has a math test on Tuesday, text her Tuesday afternoon and ask how it went. If she mentions that she loves Thai food, you might surprise her by taking her to a Thai restaurant for your next date. Consider using your phone's notes app to jot down things she likes so you'll know what to get her for her birthday, Christmas, or your anniversary.

steps.title: Start and end your day with her.
steps.content: Start and end your day with her. Once you're up and moving around in the morning, grab your phone and send her a text that says something like, "Morning babe!" or "Any big plans today?" You'll get her day off to a great start, and she'll feel important knowing you wanted to talk to her first thing. [6] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 22 September 2021. Similarly, you might sign off each night with a text like, "Dream about me! Love you" or "Sleep well, beautiful."

steps.title: This will show her that you really value her opinion.
steps.content: This will show her that you really value her opinion. You don't necessarily have to ask her to weigh in on anything life-changing, unless you actually have a big decision coming up. Even something as minor as what you should wear or what show to stream next can let her know that you respect her taste and want to hear her input. [7] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 28 September 2021. [8] X Research source [v161898_b01]. 19 August 2021. Ask things like: "Hey I need a new band to listen to, any suggestions?" "What should I say when I meet your mom?" "Do you think my red Chucks would look good with this shirt?" "I think my boss has me confused with my coworker. Can I get your opinion on what I should do?"

steps.title: Let her know she's living rent-free in your mind.
steps.content: Let her know she's living rent-free in your mind. She's got you distracted—you can't concentrate on your homework or that email to your boss because all you can think about is spending time with her. Well, let her know about it! Say something like, "I can't get anything done because I just want to text you all day." Or, you might say, "I miss you so much that it's starting to turn into a problem. Date tomorrow night?" [9] X Research source [v161898_b01]. 19 August 2021.

steps.title: She'll feel loved if she can always count on you.
steps.content: She'll feel loved if she can always count on you. If your girlfriend has a bad day or is stressed about something coming up, do your best to uplift her. Let her know you're there to listen and that you believe in her. Prove to her that you're there even in the hard times, she'll know you really love her. [10] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 10 June 2021. Try saying: "I'm so sorry you're feeling overwhelmed juggling school and work. Want me to send over some take-out so you don't have to cook tonight?" "Don't worry about that interview—you've got this!" "I hate seeing you sad. Is there anything I can do to help you feel better?" [11] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 10 June 2021.

steps.title: Let her know you see her as long-term.
steps.content: Let her know you see her as long-term. Casually drop a text that mentions something you'd like to do with her someday. It might not seem like a big deal, but mentioning that you see her in your future can actually be a big sign to her that you're taking the relationship seriously. Say something like: "I was thinking we should take a road trip next year. Is there anywhere you've always wanted to see?" "After graduation, we should get an apartment together!" "When we live somewhere with a lot of land, we should get baby goats." Sharing the same long-term goals is a great sign that you're with the right person. [12] X Research source [v161898_b01]. 19 August 2021.

steps.title: Add in details to make the moment really special.
steps.content: Add in details to make the moment really special. Do you remember how your girlfriend looked when you first saw her? Or the moment when you knew she was the one for you? Text her with a memory you really love, and she's sure to feel like she has a place in your heart. You might say, "Do you remember that time we went to the museum? I have a confession—you looked so pretty in that blue dress that I couldn't pay attention to the art at all." Or, you could say, "I was just thinking about the day we met. You had this smile that lit up the room and I knew I had to find out more about you. I'm so glad I did."

steps.title: It could be a song, a picture, or even a meme.
steps.content: It could be a song, a picture, or even a meme. If you see something that makes you think about that girl of yours, let her know! Maybe it's something romantic, but it could also just be something cute or even silly. The main thing is letting her know that she's on your mind—it's sure to make her smile. [13] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 June 2021. If you hear a song with lyrics that make you think of her, send her a link. [14] X Expert Source Suzanna Mathews Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 18 August 2021. If you see a gif that you think would crack her up, add it to a text with a note that says, "Thought of you!" Going through your gallery and you found a pic of her that's super pretty? You got it—forward it to her with a text that says something like, "OMG you're gorgeous!"

steps.title: Mention what you're grateful for.
steps.content: Mention what you're grateful for. You love your girlfriend, so you probably feel like your life is better with her in it, right? Try texting her to let her know what you appreciate about her—whether it's something she does to make your life easier or even just the way she makes you feel. For instance, you could say: [15] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 28 September 2021. "Thank you so much for making me breakfast this morning! You always get my day off to a good start." "You're such a hard worker. I really appreciate that about you." "You make me a better person."
